references.reason: This paper introduces the UGS algorithm, which is the foundation for the semi-streaming algorithm presented in this paper.

references.paper_title: Reductions in streaming algorithms, with an application to counting triangles in graphs
references.reason: This paper provides fundamental techniques for space-efficient streaming algorithms, which are crucial for adapting graphlet sampling to the semi-streaming model.

references.paper_title: On graph problems in a semi-streaming model
references.reason: This paper defines the semi-streaming model used in this work and establishes its importance for handling massive graphs.

references.paper_title: Tiered sampling: An efficient method for approximate counting sparse motifs in massive graph streams
references.reason: This paper proposes a technique for efficient motif counting in streams, which is related to the graphlet sampling problem addressed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Network motifs: Simple building blocks of complex networks
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces the concept of network motifs, providing crucial background and context for understanding the importance of graphlet sampling.
